author: sfgate.com
title: Daily Briefing, Sept. 13
text:
If you missed it ...
In a week that was a lot better for underdog female tennis players than it was for Apple — and a lot better for Apple than it was for Ellen Pao — we also saw:
• Lyft was cited by U.S. regulators, who said the ride company violated rules by not allowing customers to opt out of marketing calls and texts. The agency also cited FNB Corp. , saying the bank requires online banking and Apple Pay customers to agree to receive autodialed telemarketing texts in order to use its services. The citations notify the companies that they have violated the law and face fines if they continue to do so.
• Apple said its Watch will get an extra luxury twist in the fall, as it is creating a $1,500 smartwatch with French fashion house Hermès , the Wall Street Journal reported .
•In his second show, Stephen Colbert compared Elon Musk to supervillain Lex Luthor just because Musk said that humans could inhabit Mars faster if they dropped thermonuclear weapons over its poles. Picky, picky, picky.
The Daily Briefing is compiled from San Francisco Chronicle staff and news services. See more items and links at www.sfgate.com . Twitter: @techchronicle
